title: Hazel and the Playground
description: Hazel wants the state's botanical garden changed to a playground.

title: Hazel Makes a Will
description: Hazel meets with a lawyer to prepare her will, but George fears that Hazel plans to sue him.

title: Hazel Plays Nurse
description: When George is feeling under the weather, Hazel won't let him get out of bed to meet with an important client.

title: A Matter of Principle
description: Hazel goes to court to fight a parking ticket.

title: Dorothy's New Client
description: Dorothy's decorating business seems to have slowed down, so Hazel tries to find her new clients.

title: What'll We Watch Tonight?
description: The Baxters gets the first color TV on the block, and the neighbors crowd the house to watch it.

title: A Dog for Harold
description: Hazel tries to convince George to let Harold keep the stray dog he's brought home.

title: George's Niece
description: When Hazel plays matchmaker between George's niece and her own nephew, George's sister doesn't like it one bit.

title: Everybody's Thankful But Us Turkeys
description: It's Thanksgiving, and the Baxter's have company. George's sister is there, upset with her husband. George's mother talks of being lonely. Hazel steps in and helps each of them while trying to get the dinner made.

title: Winter Wonderland
description: The family wants to get away for a vacation, but George has to stay for work. Dorothy and Harold go on the trip, and Dorothy asks Hazel to stay with George and encourage him to stop working on join in on the family fun.

title: Hazel's Winning Personality
description: Hazel takes a course in personality improvement.

title: Hazel's Christmas Shopping
description: Hazel moonlights to earn Christmas spending money.

title: Dorothy's Obsession
description: Dorothy's problem: telling George she bought a piano.

title: Hazel's Dog Days
description: Harold finds a stray dog that he names, Smiley. Unfortunately, the rightful owners later come to the Baxter home to claim him and Hazel sets about trying to find a way for the dog to remain in the Baxter household.

title: A Replacement for Phoebe
description: Hazel helps an elderly couple, Mr. and Mrs. Johnson, to find a new maid after their own housekeeper quits.

title: Hazel's Famous Recipes
description: Hazel discovers that her recipes have been published.

title: Hazel's Tough Customer
description: Hazel tries making Mr. Griffin more sociable.

title: Hazel's Secret Wish
description: Hazel is snubbed by other vacationers at a resort.

title: Hazel, the Tryst-Buster
description: Hazel's suspicions rise as George's old girlfriend visits.

title: The Investment Club
description: A businessman tries selling worthless stock to Hazel's friends.

title: Hazel's Mona Lisa Grin
description: Hazel discovers that the artist who painted her portrait is now famous.

title: Hazel and the Gardener
description: Hazel tries boosting a gardener's self-confidence.

title: Dorothy's Birthday
description: Hazel gives up her day off to prepare food for Dorothy's luncheon.

title: Number, Please?
description: Man's innate stubbornness is the topic of this episode. Mr. Baxter is tired of getting telephone calls from salesmen, so he stubbornly insists on switching to an unlisted number. The switch is made, but he loses the new number and stubbornly insists he remembers it. Of course, he doesn't and all the family's calls are going to a small taxicab company.

title: Them New Neighbors Is Nice
description: Stan Blake's teen-age son develops a crush on Dorothy.

title: Hazel's Pajama Party
description: Hazel organizes a pajama party for a motherless girl.

title: Three Little Cubs
description: Dorothy tries getting a snobbish boy to join the Cub Scouts.

title: Bringing Out the Johnsons
description: Hazel spearheads a campaign for aid to education.

title: Hazel Quits
description: A local lake is to be drained for a new building. Hazel finds out and starts a protest. George explains it is his client that wants the lake drained. When Hazel and George argue, she moves and goes to a neighbor's for a vacationing maid.

title: Hazel the Matchmaker
description: The Baxters' neighbor, a widower with four children, finds himself in deep trouble when both George Baxter and Hazel decide to push him into marriage - to two different women.

title: Rock-A-Bye Baby
description: George Baxter grumbles when Hazel spends half her time helping the neighbors but when she brings home one of their babies - and asks him to be its sitter - he puts his foot down.

title: The Burglar in Mr. B's PJ's
description: Alan Hale, Jr. guest stars as a burglar who breaks into the Baxter's home.

title: Heat Wave
description: Hazel learns that a neighbor just had air conditioning installed. The maid at that house is a friend of hers who brags how her place has air conditioning. Hazel pesters Mr B to have air conditioning installed at his house.

title: George's Assistant
description: George decides to hire an assistant to help him at his law office. Hazel thinks it is a great idea and has a neighbor's son in mind. However, George hires a woman who just happens to be gorgeous.

title: Hazel's Day
description: Harold realizes there is a Mother's Day and a Father's Day, but no day to celebrate Hazel. So the family makes the next Sunday as Hazel's Day a grand celebration.

title: Hazel's Cousin
description: Hazel's cousin is interviewed on television for her cosmetic business, and during the interview, sh announces she is getting married. Hazel is excited and expects to be invited to the wedding.

title: Rosie's Contract
description: Hazel's friend Rosie brags that she has a contract, Hazel decides she wants one also. George decides to give Hazel what she wants.

title: We've Been So Happy Till Now
description: George & Dorothy get into a squabble, and Hazel helps patch things up.

title: How to Lure and Epicure
description: The Baxter's and Hazel go to a new restaurant for dinner and think the place is wonderful. They find out the restaurant gets a bad food review by an upset critic. Hazel and the Sunshine Girls find a way to fix things.

title: Barney Hatfield, Where Are You?
description: Barney the postman goes missing.

title: A Four-Bit Word to Chew On
description: Hazel tries to learn a new word every day. It comes in handy when Mr. Griffin has George set up an educational fund for the disadvantaged youth.

title: Hazel's Tax Deduction
description: Hazel tells the IRS that George should have made different claims on his tax return. George gets audited.

title: Mr. B on the Bench
description: George is offered a judicial position by a prominent judge. He considers accepting it, until he realizes Hazel spreads any gossip she hears.

title: License to Wed
description: Deirdre's daughter is dating Hazel's nephew and it looks like they plan to marry. Deirdre does not want this since she thinks Eddie is not good enough for her daughter. Hazel thinks they are still too young to marry.

title: Genie with the Light Brown Lamp
description: Hazel reads Harold a bedtime story about Aladdin and the Magic Lamp. The next day he sees a gravy boat in a store window and thinks it is a magic lamp. Great things begin to happen for the family and Harold thinks it is because of the lamp.

title: The Natural Athlete
description: Hazel and Mr. B square off against one another in a bowling tournament.

title: New Man in Town
description: A neighbor hires a new employee as a chauffeur. Both Hazel and Rosie are interested in capturing his attention.

title: Herbert for Hire
description: Hazel wants Mr Baxter to find a job for her friend. The friend does not have any real work experience and only has a degree in ancient languages.

title: Hazel and the Lovebirds
description: Deirdre's daughter is finished with private school and is back in town. Nancy wants to continue dating Hazel's nephew Eddy, and Deirdre wants Nancy to see other men. Hazel tries to keep Deirdre out of Nancy's love life.

title: Top Secret
description: Hazel takes a friend's daughter to see a senator, and when they leave, the accidentally take some top secret papers.

title: The Sunshine Girls Quartet
description: The Sunshine Girls Quartet are on schedule to enter a quartet contest. When George plans a business dinner the same day, Hazel says she cannot be part of the quartet. Mitch manages to get the judge to visit the party to listen to the group.

title: A Good Example for Harold
description: George uses a white lie to get out of an event with a business partner he does not like. When Hazel catches Harold using the same type of white lie, she says everyone has to stop using lies.

title: Hazel's Highland Fling
description: Mr Griffin seems to find a way to be at the Baxter's home just in time for dinner all the time. He just enjoys Hazel's cooking that much. Hazel says she will teach Mr Griffin's maid how to cook.

title: Ain't Walter Nice?
description: Dorothy invites Hazel's nephew to stay with the Baxter's when he is in town. While Walter is there, he tries to convince George to invest in plastic.

title: Mr. Griffin Throws a Wedding
description: Mr Griffin's nephew and his secretary are getting married. They want to elope, but Mr Griffin wants them to have a large wedding.

title: Hazel and the Stockholder's Meeting
description: When Hazel cannot get customer satisfaction in returning a vacuum cleaner to the store, she goes to the stockholders meeting to discuss the problems.

title: Hazel's Day Off
description: It's Hazel's day off, but she is forced to work when a wealthy man says he will donate land for a park but the contract must be written on Sunday. When the man arrives, Hazel admonishes him for not relaxing on a Sunday.

title: I've Been Singing All My Life
description: George's sister Deirdre is planning a talent show to raise money for the local hospital. Hazel wants to be part of the show, but Deirdre refuses to audition her.

title: The Fire's Never Dead, While the Ashes Are Red
description: When Hazel finds out that bookstore owner used to date the author of a new book years ago, she is determined to get the two of them together.

title: Hazel's Navy Blue Tug-Boats
description: A little girl is accidentally left behind at a gas station by her father, a Mexican diplomat. Hazel finds her and asks the police to find her father.

title: The Hazel Walk
description: George and Mr. Griffin are involved in getting a new highway built near town, but a letter to the editor criticizes them for the planned path of the road. Hazel wrote the letter.

title: Hazel Digs a Hole for Herself
description: George & Deirdre's mother visits and thinks she has nothing left to look forward to doing. Hazel gets her working in a garden, and this becomes her new passion. Deirdre thinks it is a servant's work and her mother should not be doing it.

title: Hazel Sounds Her 'A'
description: George's law firm represents a temperamental music conductor who refuses to allow a woman to be in the orchestra simply because she is a woman. Hazel decides to get the woman rehired.

title: Hazel's Luck
description: George convinces Hazel to destroy a chain letter as they are just a waste of time. Afterwards, things go wrong when the family takes a trip.

title: Oh, My Aching Back
description: Hazel likes to say "I told you so" to George, and Harold starts to think his father is not that knowledgeable. George decides to win back his son's opinion.

title: Maid of the Month
description: Hazel wins a magazine's contest for maid of the month. A magazine reporter is sent to interview her, thinking she sounds too good to be true.

title: So Long, Brown Eyes
description: A long-lost flame re-enters Hazel's life.

title: Potluck a la Mode
description: While the Baxters are out for the evening, Hazel entertains dinner guests who arrive at their house on the wrong night.

title: An Example for Hazel
description: After George's cousin's father dies, she moves in with the Baxters until she can get on her feet again. Gracie is a shy and quiet woman, and Hazel uses her own personality to help Gracie build up her confidence.

title: Dorothy Takes a Trip
description: While Dorothy is away on a trip, Hazel sees George having dinner with a pretty woman and jumps to the wrong conclusion.

title: You Ain't Fully Dressed Without a Smile
description: Dorothy is still out of town helping her aunt who has a broken heel. Hazel won a recipe contest. George wants to sell an old desk in the house, but someone tells him President Lincoln may have used it.

title: Cheerin' Up Mr. B
description: Mrs. Baxter has been out-of-town taking care of Aunt Barbara and her kids, so Hazel does her best to cheer up a lonely Mr. B.

title: Piccolo Mondo
description: George has a new client who is from Italy. Hazel decides to make a real Italian dish, but has to learn Italian so she can read the recipes.

title: Hazel Scores a Touchdown
description: Hazel decides to help the coaches of two competing football teams to become friends.

title: George's 32nd Cousin
description: Mr. B's extremely annoying, selfish cousin Sharlene invades the Baxter household, and nobody knows when she intends to leave - including the imposing Sharlene.

title: The Baby Came C.O.D.
description: George has good news - he might be invited to speak at a law school. Friends of Hazel are expecting a baby, but do not have enough money to pay the hospital. Hazel and George come up with a plan.

title: All Hazel Is Divided Into Three Parts
description: The Sunshine Girls become foster mothers to a young orphan in Italy. They hold a fund-raiser to raise money to support the child.

title: Hazel and the Vanishing Hero
description: George's childhood friend, an Olympic boxer, causes trouble when he comes to town to ask him for job.

title: Call Me Harve
description: Rose and her niece Laurie visit Hazel. Laurie lives on a farm and tells everyone about the sheep having problems keeping warm due to being sheared too soon. Hazel talks Mr. Griffin into buying sweaters for the sheep.

title: The Retiring Milkman
description: After Mr. Griffin buys the local dairy, George has to fire Hazel's friend, the Baxter's milkman.

title: Hazel's Nest Egg
description: Harold has to pass tests in order to become a tenderfoot in scouts. To encourage him, Hazel promises him a share of stock.

title: Hazel and the Halfback
description: New York Giants football star,

title: Hazel and the Model T
description: Hazel buys a 1920 Model T from the Johnsons, which soon becomes a part of Mr. Griffin's business deal.

title: Hot Potato a La Hazel
description: Hazel plays matchmaker between a friend and the antique store owner.

title: Scheherazade and Her Frying Pan: Part 1
description: George's aunt has a job with a home in Malibu. Since George & Hazel are worried, Hazel visits her. Grace is worried about the men that visit her boss. She and Hazel determine they are part of a crime ring.

title: Scheherazade and Her Frying Pan: Part 2
description: George gets involved in helping to save Grace and Hazel from Grace's employer who is involved in a crime gang.

title: The Fashion Show
description: Hazel comes to the rescue when Dorothy is unable to model in Deirdre's fashion show.

title: George's Ordeal
description: Hazel bets a chubby Mr. B that he can't lose ten pounds.

title: The Reluctant Witness
description: A tax appraiser comes to the Baxter house when a prospective client is to visit. Hazel does not realize it is the tax appraiser, and so she starts bragging and exaggerating about all the expensive items in the house. The taxes are raised.

title: Democracy at Work
description: Hazel's salary raise is put to a vote.

title: The Countess
description: Hazel receives a letter from England, which suggests the possibility that she may be a Countess.

title: Hazel's Midas Touch
description: Leo G. Carroll guest stars as a self-made millionaire.

title: Everybody's a Comedian
description: George suggests that Hazel needs glasses.

title: All Mixed Up
description: Hazel is chosen to do TV commercials.

title: Arrivederci, Mr. B
description: George searches for his client's great-grandchild.

title: Such a Nice Little Man
description: Hazel befriends a down-on-his luck man she meets in the park. The Baxter's hire him to do handy work around the house. Soon, as things disappear, they wonder if he is a thief.

title: Campaign Manager
description: Hazel finds out the city council has plans to change the park to a business area. She decides to fight city hall.

title: Let's Get Away from It All
description: George tells the family he wants to take them out to dinner. Hazel talks him into going to her friends new restaurant. Once there, things do not go well and Hazel and the Baxter's become the help.

title: Maid for a Day
description: When Deirdre finds out the local theater is putting on a play for charity, she decides to try out for the lead. She gets a part in the play, but much to her chagrin, she has to play a maid.

title: Never Trouble Trouble
description: George's cousin Fred visits again, asking for money. George refuses to give it to him.

title: Luncheon with the Governor
description: When the Baxters host the Governor at their home, his visit is protested.

title: Ain't That a Knee Slapper?
description: George tries to write a business contract for Mr Griffin and another equally difficult man. Hazel steps in to get the two men to agree.

title: Marriage Trap
description: George's secretary has an argument with her boyfriend so she goes out with another man from the law firm, Harry. Harry is flattered by her attention, so he proposes to Linda. Hazel decides to get Linda and her boyfriend back together.

title: The Flagpole
description: George gets upset when Hazel buys a thirty foot flagpole for the front yard.

title: Welcome Back, Kevin
description: When the Baxter's nephew Kevin is discharged from the army, he comes for a visit, but brings his marital problems with him.

title: Mind Your Own Business
description: Mr. B is fed up with Hazel's constant interference in his affairs, so he makes a new rule for the family that everyone will mind their own business. Hazel is not pleased.

title: High Finance Hits a New Low
description: George helps Mr. & Mrs. Johnson with their financial problems.

title: Just Me, Harold and the Universe
description: Hazel enters a housekeeping contest, but things don't turn out the way she expected.

title: Mix-Up on Marshall Road
description: Hazel sells a neighbor's house to Harry Noll and his new bride, much to George's dismay.

title: A Lesson in Diplomacy
description: On Thanksgiving, Hazel must hold her tongue when the Baxters host a foreign diplomat.

title: To Build or Not to Build
description: Hazel and Dorothy scheme to get George to remodel the kitchen.

title: Better to Have Loved and Lost
description: Harry Noll and his new bride Rita move next door to the Baxters and Hazel has to mediate their first fight.

title: Hazel Squares the Triangle
description: After George's sister Deirdre has a fight with her husband, Hazel sneaks into a men's club get the couple back together.

title: Just 86 Shopping Minutes to Christmas
description: George becomes a scrooge when he refuses to give in to the commercialism of Christmas.

title: Champagne Tony
description: Hazel misplaces

title: It's a Dog's Life
description: The Baxters entertain a client and their dog.

title: Love 'em and Leave 'em
description: Harold trades his prized football for a date to the school party.

title: Temper, Temper
description: Hazel must contend with George's client, a hot tempered Italian woman.

title: Bonnie Boy
description: Havoc breaks out when Hazel buys George a winning sweepstakes ticket for his birthday.

title: Stop Rockin' Our Reception
description: George Baxter blames a ham radio operator for his television reception problems until Hazel provides a solution.

title: What's Buggin' Hazel?
description: George's client, Mr. Egan, is convinced his office is being bugged by a competitor.

title: Hazel's Day in Court
description: Hazel ends up in jail for defacing public property.

title: Hazel's Inquisitive Mind
description: When a new neighbor moves in, Hazel tries to recruit him as a client for Mr. Baxter.

title: George's Man Friday
description: A man that George defends proposes marriage to Hazel.

title: The Investor
description: Hazel buys 25% of a bakery and the begins moonlighting there.

title: Who's in Charge Here?
description: When George and Dorothy move to Baghdad to work on one of Mr. Griffin's oil deals, Hazel and Harold move in with George's brother Steve, his wife Barbara, and their daughter Suzy.

title: Hazel's Second Week
description: With Hazel taking over the housekeeping, Barbara feels left out.

title: How to Lose 30 Pounds in 30 Minutes
description: Wanting to earn extra money to pay for a weight loss course, Hazel sells real estate for Steve.

title: Do Not Disturb Occupants
description: The Baxters sell their house and soon have sellers remorse.

title: The Holdout
description: After a widow sells her house to Steve's client, it's found out that she's been swindled, so it's up to Hazel to save the day.

title: A-Haunting We Will Go
description: Steve is sued for selling a haunted house to a client, until Hazel comes to the rescue.

title: Hazel Needs a Car
description: After Steve refuses to lend Hazel the money to buy a car, she goes into the fish breeding business to raise the money.

title: Hazel Sits It Out
description: Steve has plans to take Susie and Harold fishing. One of his real estate clients arrives at the house and tells Steve he has to find an agent to hold an open house at one of his homes. Hazel sits in as a real estate agent.

title: A Lot to Remember
description: Hazel and Barbara go to a land auction. Hazel gets caught up in bidding and wins a plot of land for a few hundred. When she tells Steve which lot she purchased, she finds out it is a small strip of land, just about worth nothing.

title: A Bull's Eye for Cupid
description: The Baxters spend their wedding anniversary on a fishing trip.

title: The Crush
description: Millie has a crush on Steve.

title: Kindly Advise
description: Suzy is unhappy when Barbara enrolls her in charm school, at Deirdre's insistence.

title: Noblesse Oblige
description: Hazel runs afoul of a wealthy woman and befriends her husband.

title: Hazel's Endearing Young Charms
description: After Hazel keeps bragging about the success of his brother, Steve gets an inferiority complex.

title: A Car Named Chrysanthemum
description: Hazel buys a 1930 Model A in need of a lot of work, much to Steve's dismay.

title: Once an Actor
description: Barbara's uncle visits. He is once-famous actor, out of work and money. Hazel and Barbara convince Steve to hire him at the real estate office. A few bad deals turn into successes. Also, he gets a call for Hollywood for a part in a show.

title: $285 by Saturday
description: Hazel is collecting musical instruments to send to George & Dorothy for a missionary school. She also holds a fund-raiser for enough money to buy an organ.

title: Boom or Bust
description: Steve puts the household on a budget.

title: Harold's Gift Horses
description: Harold's teacher and Steve's client compete for Harold's affection.

title: How to Find Work Without Really Trying
description: After winning dinner for two in a contest, Hazel selects a complete stranger as her dinner companion.

title: My Son, the Sheepdog
description: Hoping to win a TV show contest, Harold starts his own rock band.

title: Please Don't Shout
description: Steve has a difficult house to sell because it is located next to a busy, and noisy, highway. Hazel finds the perfect couple to buy the house - they are hard of hearing.

title: But Is It Art?
description: Hazel mistakes a famous artist for the man she hire to come and paint her room.

title: Who Can Afford a Bargain?
description: Fred and Mona Williams consider buying a house from Steve, which results in them having a fight.

title: Hazel's Free Enterprise
description: Hazel sells her chili sauce to a supermarket to earn money for Steve's birthday gift.

title: Bee in Her Bonnet
description: Steve impresses a wealthy client with his good deed.

title: The Perfect Boss
description: Hazel writes an essay about Steve for a newspaper contest.

title: A Little Bit of Genius
description: When Harold's friend Jeff is put in an advanced class at school, a rift develops between them.

title: A Question of Ethics
description: Steve gets into trouble with the real estate association after Hazel gives some bad advice to her friends.
